title: How Many Calories in a Cup of Sugar?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in cup of sugar, including carbs, sugars, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with quick tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in a Cup of Sugar?
assumptions: Granulated white sugar; 1 cup ≈ 200 g (unpacked, level measure).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (white, brown, powdered), brand, packing density, and measurement accuracy. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of granulated sugar provides about 774 kcal, all from carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use powdered sugar (≈120 g per cup)

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of sugar?
faqs.a: About 774 kcal for one cup (200 g) of granulated white sugar.

faqs.q: Is all the calories in sugar from carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, 100% from carbohydrates, specifically 200 g of sugars per cup.

faqs.q: How does brown sugar compare calorie-wise?
faqs.a: Similar at ≈754 kcal per cup, with slightly more minerals but same carbs.

faqs.q: What's the calorie difference with powdered sugar?
faqs.a: Lower at ≈484 kcal per cup due to air incorporation (≈120 g).

faqs.q: Does sugar have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: No, pure sugar is 0 g protein and 0 g fat; all energy from carbs.
